result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sarena Jean Harmon

records.addlTxt: Per direction of Court, letter sent to def and SPD notified successor counsel is to be appointed through SPD.
to def advising SPD to appoint successor counsel

Defendant Sarena Jean Harmon in court.  Attorney Nolan A. Jensen in court for Sarena Jean Harmon.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel has motioned to withdraw.  Court questions def and admonishes re right to counsel.  Court allows Atty Jensen to withdraw and appoints Atty Tsz-King as successor counsel.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing. 
Hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as Attorney for Defendant - PER COURT, to be addressed at hearing set 9-28-22
22R 016414; Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #16142 on 8-26-22
Absolute sobriety. No use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Sarena Jean Harmon in court, in custody.  Attorney Timothy Drewa appeared by video for Sarena Jean Harmon.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Defendant eligible for State Public Defender. State requests $750 cash bond. Court orders $200 cash bond. Preliminary hearing time limits waived. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.
